meanings.definition: Aeronautics: a maneuver in which an aircraft turns by rolling on its side and describing a circular path in the air.
meanings.sent1: During the air show, the pilot amazed the crowd with his flawless wingovers.
meanings.sent2: The skilled pilot executed perfect wingovers during the aerobatic display.
meanings.sent3: The airplane's wingovers made the spectators cheer in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The graceful wingovers of the aircraft painted arcs in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The pilot's wingovers left a lasting impression on everyone watching.

meanings.definition: Verb: to perform a wingover maneuver in an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The pilot will wingover the plane to change direction smoothly.
meanings.sent2: Remember to wingover gently to avoid losing control of the aircraft.
meanings.sent3: The pilot decided to wingover the plane for a fun twist.
meanings.sent4: She wingovers the aircraft with precision and skill.
meanings.sent5: To master flying, one must learn how to wingover effectively.

meanings.definition: Noun: the act of executing a wingover maneuver.
meanings.sent1: The wingovers performed by the pilot were truly impressive.
meanings.sent2: The audience applauded the flawless execution of the wingovers.
meanings.sent3: The wingovers added excitement to the air show.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for aviation was evident in her perfect wingovers.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the wingovers captured the attention of all spectators.
